title: Diazo Print, "Design for Woven Textile-Linline, Series #440", mid-20th century
inscribed: Imprinted lower left under design: This drawing actual size of pattern; upper left above design: black stripe [arrow]; at lower right : COLOR REPEATS NOTED 1-6; lower right: DESIGN FOR FABRIC SERIES #440 LINLINE/ DATE: 25 FEB.1959 / SCALE: 1:1 / BY: pd / JOB NO. #440 / DRAWING NO. / ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT / P.O. BOX 2168 SANTA FE, NEW MEXICO
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Horizontal design of narrow and dark vertical stripes alternating with wide white verticals.

tombstone.epitaph: Diazo Print, "Design for Woven Textile-Linline, Series #440", mid-20th century.Blueprint on off-white wove paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-293.
